definition: to baffle/to confound/to stump
difficult (to...)/problem/difficulty/difficult/not good
disaster/distress/to scold
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit

sentences.english: A man money is no man at all.
I never believed until then that any meal could defeat me.
sentences.chinese: 在那之前我从来也不相馆饭食能够难倒我。

sentences.english: Thequestion baffled me completely and I could not answer.
sentences.chinese: 这个问题把我完全难倒了，我答不出来。

sentences.english: Without money, even a hero will be driven against the wall.
sentences.chinese: 一分钱也能难倒英雄汉。

sentences.english: But he was stumped when asked to name Britain's leader.
sentences.chinese: 但被问到谁是英国首相时，小男孩被难倒了。

sentences.english: This question is so difficult that I can't answer .
sentences.chinese: 这个问题把我彻底难倒了，我答不出来。

sentences.english: The professor is never at a nonplus , and never perplexed by a problem.
sentences.chinese: 那位教授从未感到困惑，也没有被任何问题所难倒。

sentences.english: Honest, to tell the truth, I'm about stumped.
sentences.chinese: 凭良心说，说真心话，我差不多要被难倒了。

sentences.english: The speaker was completely nonplussed by the question.
sentences.chinese: 演讲者被这个问题完全难倒了。

sentences.english: What do you do when you're stuck with a question while studying Physics?
sentences.chinese: 当你在学习物理时被一个问题难倒了怎么办？

sentences.english: It was a little up-tempo for slow dancing, but that didn't seem to concern him.
sentences.chinese: 这对慢舞来说节奏有点快，但这似乎并没有难倒他。

sentences.english: The question is hard to me，I can't answer it.
sentences.chinese: 这个问题把我彻底难倒了，我答不出来。

sentences.english: Do not let these concerns overwhelm you.
sentences.chinese: 不要让这些问题难倒你。

definition: to baffle/to stump
not to pose a problem for sb/cannot stump sb
to bother/to press sb, usu. to do sth/it's a tough job/sorry to bother you (polite, used to thank sb for a favor)
to accomplish/to get sth done
to figure out/to work out (a solution etc)/to think up/to come up with (an idea etc)
stretch a hand and grab it (idiom); very easy
(usually used in the negative) to answer or reply to sb's question
a small appetizer/a piece of cake; very easy (idiom)
to stump sb with a question
to feel embarrassed/to feel akward
see 百思不解[bai3 si1 bu4 jie3]
pinyin: bai3 si1 bu4 de2 qi2 jie3

definition: to be frightened
to fix/to settle/to wangle
puzzle/riddle
highly intelligent (idiom)
to imagine the wildest thing/to indulge in fantasy
